value: There was a man from Ramathaim Zophim,
from the hill country of Ephraim, whose name was Elkanah. He was the son of Jeroham, the son of Elihu, the son of Tohu, the son of Zuph, an Ephraimite.
He had two wives; the name of the first was Hannah and the name of the second was Peninnah. Now Peninnah had children, but Hannah was childless.
this man would go up from his city to worship and to sacrifice to the
of hosts at Shiloh. It was there that the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phineas, served as the
Whenever the day came for Elkanah to sacrifice, he used to give meat portions to his wife Peninnah and to all her sons and daughters.
But he would give a double
portion to Hannah, because he especially loved her.
had not enabled her to have children.
Her rival wife used to upset her and make her worry,
had not enabled her to have children.
would behave this way year after year. Whenever Hannah
would upset her so that she would weep and refuse to eat.
Finally her husband Elkanah said to her, “Hannah, why do you weep and not eat? Why are you so sad?
Am I not better to you than ten
On one occasion in Shiloh, after they had finished eating and drinking, Hannah got up.
(Now at the time Eli the priest was sitting in his chair
of hosts, if you will look with compassion
on the suffering of your female servant,
remembering me and not forgetting your servant, and give a male child
to your servant, then I will dedicate him to the
all the days of his life. His hair will never be cut.”
Now Hannah was speaking from her heart. Although her lips were moving, her voice was inaudible. Eli therefore thought she was drunk.
said to her, “How often do you intend to get drunk? Put away your wine!”
But Hannah replied, “That’s not the way it is,
my lord! I am under a great deal of stress.
I have drunk neither wine nor beer. Rather, I have poured out my soul to
Don’t consider your servant a wicked woman,
for until now I have spoken from my deep pain and anguish.”
Eli replied, “Go in peace, and may the God of Israel grant the request that you have asked of him.”
She said, “May I, your servant, find favor in your sight.” So the woman went her way and got something to eat.
Her face no longer looked sad.
They got up early the next morning and after worshiping the
, they returned to their home at Ramah. Elkanah had marital relations with
After some time Hannah became pregnant and gave birth to a son. She named him Samuel, thinking, “I asked the
This man Elkanah went up with all his family to make the yearly sacrifice to the
but Hannah did not go up with them.
Instead she told her husband, “Once the boy is weaned, I will bring him and appear before the
, and he will remain there from then on.”
So her husband Elkanah said to her, “Do what you think best.
Stay until you have weaned him. May the
So the woman stayed and nursed her son until she had weaned him.
Once she had weaned him, she took him up with her, along with three bulls, an ephah
of wine. She brought him to the
’s house at Shiloh, even though he was young.
Once the bull had been slaughtered, they brought the boy to Eli.
She said, “Just as surely as you are alive, my lord, I am the woman who previously stood here with you in order to pray to the
I prayed for this boy, and the
has given me the request that I asked of him.
Now I dedicate him to the
